oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Chrysaster ostensackenella (Fitch, 1859), a potentially invasive species newly recorded from Europe (Lepidoptera, Gracillariidae)
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Huemer, Peter
Mayr, Toni
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: invasive species
Gracillariidae
Chrysaster ostensackenella
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Chrysaster ostensackenella (Fitch, 1859), originally a New World species with recent records from East Asia, is newly reported from Europe (Italy, Province Rieti). The potentially invasive species is a trophic leaf-mining specialist on Robinia. Species identification is based on DNA barcoding and morphological characteristics.
